abstract: Utica City School District settles lawsuit filed by New York State accusing it of placing refugee children in substandard programs instead of enrolling them in district's only public high school; settlement requires district to offer compensatory schooling for students, and to hire monitors to ensure compliance with federal and state laws.

headline.print_headline: Utica Settles State Claim on Refugee Students
headline.main: Utica Settles State Claim Alleging Biased Enrollment for Refugee Students

snippet: The lawsuit claimed that immigrant students had been funneled into substandard alternative programs rather than being enrolled in the district’s only public high school....
lead_paragraph: The lawsuit claimed that immigrant students had been funneled into substandard alternative programs rather than being enrolled in the district’s only public high school.
